intro: Sisymbrium brassicoides, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features lobed leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in racemes. The plant produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is commonly found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its cruciform flowers and is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other economically important plants.
